text: The Head Hunters is an album by American jazz drummer Chico Hamilton featuring performances recorded in 1968 and originally released on the Solid State label.Payne, D., Solid State Records discography accessed June 30, 2015 ==Reception== The Allmusic review by Scott Yanow called it an "intriguing if erratic set" stating "not essential, but it is a missing link in the long career of Chico Hamilton". ==Track listing== All compositions by Chico Hamilton except as indicated # "Guitar Willie" - 5:04 # "Reach and Grab It" - 5:30 # "I Found It" - 1:05 # "Head Hunters" - 4:25 # "Conglomerates" - 6:00 # "Ol' Man" (Jimmy Cheatham) - 3:12 # "Cee Ee Jaaa" - 3:25 # "Them's Good Ole Days" - 5:30 ==Personnel== *Chico Hamilton - drums *Steve Potts - alto saxophone *Russ Andrews - tenor saxophone *Robert Ashton - baritone saxophone *Ray Nance - violin *Eric Gale - guitar *Jan Arnet - bass == References == Category:Solid State Records (jazz label) albums Category:Chico Hamilton albums Category:1969 albums
title: The Head Hunters
